result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Umland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Credit for time served:  1/3/15 to 1/6/15 - 3 days

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert R Umland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert R Umland in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire received and reviewed by the Court.  ADA Niemi recites a sentence recommendation.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Victim makes a statement to the Court.  Court makes its findings and pronounces sentence.

Defendant Robert R Umland in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2 cases scheduled for Plea/sentencing today.  Atty Brabazon represents defendant on 14CT141 and informs the court that he had subpoen'd a counselor from Shawano Community Programs to be here today; however, she is not.  Atty Haacke would also request that this case be postponed because he would like to talk to the counselor, as well.    Bond continues with all conditions.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:15 am.
from DA to Aty Haacke re: copy of pg's 1-28 & defendant's driver/criminal record

Defendant Robert R Umland appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Catharine Denise White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
